title: Impulse Space wins $34.5 million contract for U.S. Space Force missions
summary: The company will provide two orbital transfer vehicles that will carry space surveillance payloads for the U.S. military’s Tactically Responsive Space program

title: ULA Vulcan Centaur Completes Cert-2 Mission Despite SRB Explosion
summary: ULA Vulcan Centaur Completes Cert-2 Mission Despite SRB Explosion

title: NASA Announces Teams for 2025 Student Launch Challenge
summary: NASA has selected 71 teams from across the U.S. to participate in its 25th annual Student Launch Challenge, one of the agency’s Artemis Student Challenges. The competition is aimed at inspiring Artemis Generation students to explore science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) for the benefit of humanity. As part of the challenge, teams will design, […]

title: Final Frontier to Raise €150M to Invest in European Space Startups
summary: Copenhagen-based venture capital fund Final Frontier is aiming to raise €150 million to invest in European startups developing innovative space and defence capabilities. Final Frontier was founded on 1 October by Niels Vejrup Carlsen, who previously served as the General Partner at SEED Capital Denmark. Carlsen is also an investment partner of the European Space […]

title: NASA Announces Teams to Compete in International Rover Challenge
summary: NASA has selected 75 student teams to begin an engineering design challenge to build rovers that will compete next spring at the U.S. Space and Rocket Center near the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. The competition is one of the agency’s Artemis Student Challenges, encouraging students to pursue degrees and careers in […]

title: Commercial Space Transformers
summary: The SpaceNews Commercial Space Transformer video series will give viewers a behind-the-scenes look at the people and companies driving the space industry”s commercial transformation. The weekly series will feature 15-minute […]

title: ULA launches second Vulcan flight, encounters strap-on booster anomaly
summary: United Launch Alliance fired off a next-generation Vulcan rocket Friday in the second of two "certification" test flights needed before the new launcher can be used to carry high-priority national security payloads for the U.S. Space Force and the National Reconnaissance Office. One of two solid-propellant strap-on boosters provided by Northrop Grumman suffered an anomaly of some sort. ULA CEO Tory Bruno said it will be investigated.

title: Vulcan competes second flight despite SRB anomaly
summary: United Launch Alliance’s second Vulcan Centaur lifted off Oct. 4 on a test flight needed to certify the vehicle for carrying national security payloads, but may have suffered a problem with one of its solid rocket boosters.
